name: content_productstatuses_get
description: Gets the status of a product from your Merchant Center account.

merchantId.description: The ID of the account that contains the product. This account cannot be a multi-client account.

productId.description: The REST ID of the product.

destinations.description: If set, only issues for the specified destinations are returned, otherwise only issues for the Shopping destination.

fields.description: Selector specifying which fields to include in a partial response.

key.description: API key. Your API key identifies your project and provides you with API access, quota, and reports. Required unless you provide an OAuth 2.0 token.

oauth_token.description: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

prettyPrint.description: Returns response with indentations and line breaks.

quotaUser.description: Available to use for quota purposes for server-side applications. Can be any arbitrary string assigned to a user, but should not exceed 40 characters.

$block: The status of a product, that is, information about a product computed asynchronously.

$ul: **creationDate**: Date on which the item has been created, in ISO 8601 format.
**destinationStatuses**: The intended destinations for the product.
**googleExpirationDate**: Date on which the item expires in Google Shopping, in ISO 8601 format.
**itemLevelIssues**: A list of all issues associated with the product.
**kind**: Identifies what kind of resource this is. Value: the fixed string "`content#productStatus`"
**lastUpdateDate**: Date on which the item has been last updated, in ISO 8601 format.
**productId**: The ID of the product for which status is reported.
